Description: Egyptian terracotta figurine of Isis-Hathor. Fragment of bare feet only. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt with mica and white sandy inclusions.
Curator's comments: Found in third to the second century BC context. Leg and feet fragment of a Isis-Aphrodite anasyr(o)mene’ / Isis-Bubastis or more likely Isis-Hathor figure. Parallels dated to the Ptolemaic or Roman period across Egypt, with close parallels from Naukratis (Bailey 2008, no.2997, GR 1888,0601.110; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1888.178; Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA636).
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 169, no.10 pl. 3.8c.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.140) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.8c, p. 169. no.10 (catalogue number)
